Description: The library that houses the lab content that was taken.
The lab slug of the associated lab that was taken.
The lab version of the associated lab that was taken.
The lab revision of the associated lab that was taken.
The default lab title of the associated lab. This is almost always the lab's title in English which may not be the title the student saw in their locale.
The difficulty of the lab.
The time the lab was started.
The time the lab was ended. A student can manually end a lab by pressing the 'End Lab' button. Labs are automatically ended if the lab has been running for the whole duration.
The duration of the lab instance (i.e. the number of seconds from when the lab started until it ended).
The Qwiklabs user id of the student who took the lab.
The student's opinion of the lab on a scale of 1 - 5 where 5 is the best. A student can leave a separate rating every time they take a lab.
The feedback a student left about the lab. A student can leave different feedback every time they take a lab.
The percentage of total possible points needed to pass the assessment.
The percentage of total achieved points to date on the assessment.
True if the student passed the assessment for this lab. Lab creators can specify that students don't need to get a perfect score in order to pass.
The country the student was in when they took the lab.
The locale of the lab content that the user took.
The user's locale setting when they took the lab.
The corresponding lab instance id.
The type of payment provided by the user, or 'None' if no payment was provided (e.g. for a free lab, LTI session, or classroom).

True if the lab is part of the GCP curriculum. Note that this does not imply anything about the cloud environment. For example, a GCP Course about migrating from AWS to GCP may have labs that use AWS and labs that use GCP but all would have is_gcp_content set to True.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the id of the course enrollment.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the timestamp of when the user enrolled.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the timestamp of when the user completed the course.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the date the course session begins.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the date the course session ends.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the country where the course session takes place. Uses 'Virtual' for online/virtual sessions.

If this lab was taken as part of a course, the training platform that owns the course session. Can also be thought of as the platform that subscribed to the course content, and/or the platform driving the course outline experience.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the training partner that is running the course session.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the type of the course session.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the id of the course session.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the title of the course.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the library that houses the course.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the slug of the course.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the version of the course.
If this lab was taken as part of a course, the revision of the course.
The name of the entity if this lab was taken as an SPL on an external platform rather than on Qwiklabs directly.
If True, the lab instance was taken on a deployment that is learner facing.
If True, the user has the role student.
